intro: Psychotria fasciculiflora, commonly known as the "Coca plant" in some regions, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly the Andean countries. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that contain the alkaloid cocaine. This plant has significant ecological and historical importance due to its role in traditional medicine and its use in the production of illicit drugs.
